page.title: 16Scout Jamboree 1985
page.content: In July, 5,000 scouts converged on Margam Park for the largest Jamboree ever held in Wales. An event staged at a cost of Â£125,000. The 1500 tents covered an area of 50 acres and housed scouts from 15 countries. Electricity, water, toilets and other services had to be provided, and in addition the scouts had their own Post Office, supermarket, bank and newspaper, the 'Margam Mail'. A radio station was set up with a special call sign and broadcasts were made to radio hams throughout the world. Activities enjoyed included: abseiling, parascend -ing, swimming and rock climbing. The Duke of Kent paid a three hour visit to the Jamboree, but part of the itinerary had to be cancelled because of the driving rain which persisted for most of the event.
